intro: Epilobium alsineifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaf willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, disturbed soils such as along riverbanks and roadsides. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink to red flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Epilobium alsineifolium is often found in wet meadows and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
